anecdotes.content: If it hurts, do it more often
anecdotes.author: Jezz Smart

anecdotes.content: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later!
anecdotes.author: Jeff Bezoz

anecdotes.content: The first 90 percent of the code accounts for the first 90 percent of the development time...The remaining 10 percent of the code accounts for the other 90 percent of the development time.
anecdotes.author: Micheal Smith

anecdotes.content: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
anecdotes.author: James Morgan

anecdotes.content: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
anecdotes.author: Johnson Farde

anecdotes.content: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.
anecdotes.author: Emmanuel Solomon

anecdotes.content: If it hurts, do it more often
anecdotes.author: Jez Humble

anecdotes.content: Premature optimization is the root of all evil
anecdotes.author: Donald Knuth

anecdotes.content: Checking if the navigate is working
anecdotes.author: Godwin Smith
